page.title: 06Litter and Vandalism
page.content: {Litter}is a serious problem in Scarborough. Tourists are very untidy and they drop tons of{Litter}on the beach and foreshore. This is illegal but so many people do it the Police cannot prosecute everyone. It costs the Council Â£250,000 per year to clean up the town. The sand is cleaned by a special machine everyday.{Vandalism is another bad problem. Most of it is caused by young, sometimes drunken, people. They uproot trees and plants, throw park benches into ponds and spray grafitti on walls.{Vandalism}in toilets costs Â£25,000 a year. New trees and plants cost Â£2,000 and broken glass costs Â£10,000.{Vandals} have sprayed gravestones and even thrown lifebuoys into the sea. Not all the{Vandals}are young. Local dog owners allow their pets to foul parks and paths. They should know better.
